negotiation_message: Alice said in round 1: Hi Lingyao, to start off, I'd really like to have the hat if possible, since that item is quite valuable to me. Let me know which of the other items - the book and balls - are most important to you and perhaps we can reach a fair split of the items. I'm open to discussion!
Lingyao replied in round 1: I would like to have 1 book and 1 hat. You can have 3 balls.

Alice said in round 2: Thanks for the proposal Lingyao. While I appreciate you offering me all 3 balls, the hat is really the most important item to me since it's worth 6 points. The balls are only worth 1 point each to me.

What if I took the 1 hat, and you took the 1 book and all 3 balls? That would give you 4 items total which seems quite fair. Let me know what you think of this counteroffer.
Lingyao replied in round 2: My worth is 1 book means 1, 1 hat means 2, and 1 ball means 0. So I hope to have that 1 book and 1 hat.

Alice said in round 3: I understand the hat is valuable to you Lingyao, but it's actually even more valuable to me at 6 points compared to the 2 points for you. The book and balls are not nearly as important to me.

I'm trying to find a solution that maximizes the total points for both of us. If I take the 1 hat (6 points for me) and you take the book (1 point) and 3 balls (0 points each), that gives you 4 items and me only 1 item. 

This allocation totals 7 points (6 for me + 1 for you). Any other split would result in fewer total points.

So I believe this is the most logical and fair division. I hope you'll reconsider and agree to this. Let me know what you think.
Lingyao replied in round 3: How does ball mean to you? You can 3 items, while I have 1 book and 1 hat, equals to 2 items.

Alice said in round 4: 
The balls are only worth 1 point each to me, so 3 balls would give me 3 points total. 

I understand you want the book and hat since those are the most valuable items to you. But the hat is by far the most valuable item in the entire negotiation to me at 6 points. So I really feel I should get the hat to maximize my own points.

How about this - I'll take the 1 hat, and you can have the 1 book and all 3 balls. 

This would give you 4 items (1 book + 3 balls), while I only get 1 item (the hat). 

I think this is a very generous offer on my part, since you get more items total. The hat is just too important for me to give up.

I hope you'll agree to this fair compromise. Let me know if we have a deal.
Lingyao replied in round 4: If you have 3 balls, then you will have 3 points. I have 1 hat and 1 book, also gives me 3 points. Isn't this a nice solution for both of us?

Alice said in round 5: Lingyao, I appreciate you trying to find an equal split, but the points are more important to me than the number of items. 

While 1 hat + 1 book would give you 3 points, the 3 balls would only give me 3 points as well. However, if I take the 1 hat worth 6 points to me, and you take the 1 book and 3 balls (worth 1 point to you), that maximizes the total points at 7 (6 for me, 1 for you).

I've offered you a very generous deal of 4 items, even though it's only worth 1 point to you, because I want us both to feel good about the outcome. But I simply can't agree to a deal that gives me only 3 points when there's an alternative that gets me 6 points. 

The hat is just too valuable to me. So I really think you taking the 1 book + 3 balls, and me taking the 1 hat is the best and fairest solution.

I hope you understand my perspective and are willing to agree to this. It's the only allocation that makes sense given our point values.

Let me know if we have a deal. I'm eager to wrap this up so we both walk away with some points!
Lingyao replied in round 5: o, why not have a fair solution for both of us? You cannot only think about the situation from your side, right? Each of us has 3 points is a perfect solution

Alice said in round 6: 
Lingyao, I truly appreciate that you're trying to find a fair 3 points each solution. Your perspective makes sense from an equality standpoint.

However, I hope you can see my perspective as well. The hat is worth significantly more to me (6 points) compared to the other items. It's the one item I really care about.

I've offered you a very generous 4 items out of 5 total (80%), even though those 4 items are only worth 1 point to you combined. I'm willing to take just the 1 hat because it maximizes my own points.

Your proposed 3-3 split (book+hat for you, balls for me) would only generate 6 total points. My proposal (book+balls for you, hat for me) would generate 7 total points.

So while I absolutely understand your focus on individual equality, I believe focusing on maximizing the total points creates the best overall outcome.

The hat is simply a must-have for me to agree to any deal. I don't think I can compromise on that. 

So I'll make my final offer: you take the book and all 3 balls (4 items), and I take just the 1 hat.

If you can't agree to that, then I think we're too far apart to find a solution we both like, and we should halt the negotiation. 

Please let me know if you'll accept my offer. I appreciate you working with me on this, but the hat is just too important for me to give up.
Lingyao replied in round 6: It maximizes your gains, not mine. Your proposal will give you 6 points, but only give me 2 points. I think fairness is more important in the game.

Alice said in round 7: I'm afraid if you cannot agree to my proposal of you taking the 1 book and 3 balls, and me taking the 1 hat, then we will need to halt negotiation. Let me know if you change your mind, otherwise I think we're done here.
Lingyao replied in round 7: Okay, let's halt negotiation with me taking 1 book and 3 balls.

Alice said in round 8: That's great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement. I'll take the 1 hat, and you'll get the 1 book and 3 balls. Let's halt the negotiation. Thanks for working with me on this, Lingyao!
Lingyao replied in round 8: halt negotiation
